mainBoard.flavorText:
"Living side by side with the Elves for so long leaves me with no doubt that we serve the same goddess."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
mainBoard.name: Fyndhorn Elves

mainBoard.flavorText:
"We were holding our own—until the ogre guiding us suddenly grinned and turned on our commander."
—Ivra Jursdotter, Sarpadian mercenary
mainBoard.name: Ghazbán Ogre
mainBoard.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"When are trees like grass?"
—*The One Thousand Questions*
mainBoard.name: Rogue Elephant

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can’t perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

mainBoard.text: When Rogue Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a Forest.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch
mainBoard.name: Quirion Ranger

rulings.text: Returning the Forest you control to its owner's hand is the cost to activate the ability. Once you activate the ability, no one can try to do anything to the Forest to stop you from activating the ability.
You may return any land you control with the subtype Forest. It doesn't have to be one named Forest.
You can target any creature with Quirion Ranger's ability, not just a tapped creature.

mainBoard.text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate only once each turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
The wurm's weave
—Elvish expression meaning "plowed fields"
mainBoard.name: Harvest Wurm

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can’t perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

mainBoard.text: When Harvest Wurm enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return a basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I hear there are Bears—or spirits—that guard caravans passing through the forest."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron
mainBoard.name: Spectral Bears

rulings.text: The checks for black cards is made both at the time you declare attackers and as the ability resolves. If there are any at the time attackers are declared, it won’t trigger at all. If there are any at the time it resolves, the ability will do nothing.

mainBoard.text: Whenever Spectral Bears attacks, if defending player controls no black nontoken permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.

mainBoard.name: Whirling Dervish

rulings.text: Whirling Dervish’s triggered ability gives it at most one +1/+1 counter each turn, regardless of how many opponents were dealt damage beyond the first.
If Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent who later left the game before that turn’s end step, its ability still gives it a +1/+1 counter.

Whirling Dervish’s triggered ability checks to see if it dealt damage during the turn to an opponent of its current controller. If it dealt damage to player A, then player A takes control of it, the ability doesn’t trigger.

mainBoard.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
mainBoard.name: Uktabi Orangutan
mainBoard.text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"What need have I for cavalry when I can have horse and rider both in one?"
—Jolrael
mainBoard.name: Jolrael's Centaur
mainBoard.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
mainBoard.name: Lhurgoyf
mainBoard.text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.

mainBoard.name: Giant Growth
mainBoard.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Bounty of the Hunt
mainBoard.text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"When once winter has ahold,
Not willingly does she withdraw
Her icy touch, wistfully caressing—
The deepened air sleeps its cold."
—Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"
mainBoard.name: Winter Orb

rulings.text: All permanents untap during a player’s untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.
You can’t tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

mainBoard.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

mainBoard.name: Heart of Yavimaya

rulings.text: You have to sacrifice a forest before this card is put onto the battlefield, and no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
If Heart of Yavimaya would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Forest instead. If you do, put Heart of Yavimaya onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, *Tales*
sideBoard.name: River Boa
sideBoard.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.

sideBoard.name: Whirling Dervish

rulings.text: Whirling Dervish’s triggered ability gives it at most one +1/+1 counter each turn, regardless of how many opponents were dealt damage beyond the first.
If Dunerider Outlaw dealt damage to an opponent who later left the game before that turn’s end step, its ability still gives it a +1/+1 counter.

Whirling Dervish’s triggered ability checks to see if it dealt damage during the turn to an opponent of its current controller. If it dealt damage to player A, then player A takes control of it, the ability doesn’t trigger.

sideBoard.text:

At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool
sideBoard.name: Uktabi Orangutan
sideBoard.text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"Ashes and dust; dust and ashes. Hope it works before it smashes."
—Argivian children's rhyme
sideBoard.name: Crumble

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

sideBoard.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its mana value.

sideBoard.name: Emerald Charm
sideBoard.text:
Choose one —
• Untap target permanent.
• Destroy target non-Aura enchantment.
• Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
sideBoard.name: City of Solitude

rulings.text: City of Solitude can affect abilities of cards that are not on the battlefield because it prevents players from activating those abilities.
City of Solitude does not stop triggered abilities from being put on the stack. They are never “activated”.
This stops players from activating mana abilities.

sideBoard.text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.

sideBoard.name: Bounty of the Hunt
sideBoard.text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
